result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Schroedl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay cost of $243 + $75 drug testing fee + $200 DNA Surcharge = $518; due in $25 increments per month, beginning 11/15/15 and on the 15th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 11 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Schroedl

defendant.name: Schroedl, James R.
defendant.address: 915 S. Main St., Apt 219, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant James R. Schroedl in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e), a misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay cost of $243 + $75 drug testing fee + $200 DNA Surcharge = $518; due in $25 incriments per month, beginning 11/15/15 and on the 15th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 11 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Recess: 11:13 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:36pm [mo]
Defendant James R. Schroedl in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court directs Atty. Dahnert to follow up with the Jail as to the status of Mr. Schroedl's booking.
recess: 2:38pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/26/15 at 2:40pm   (2) Status Conference on 10/6/15 at 8:30am
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:37 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant James R. Schroedl in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 & #2
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; Finds no conflict or need to recuse or disqualify
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Schroedl informs the Court that he would like to proceed without counsel
Court further reviews right to counsel. Mr. Schroedl waives this right; Court does not find him competent to represent himself

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 2:52 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 8/4/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices **Address time limits**
